meanings.definition: A group of people moving or going in an upward direction.
meanings.sent1: The upgang of friends climbed the hill together.
meanings.sent2: We watched the upgang of birds flying high in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The upgang of ants marching up the tree was quite a sight.
meanings.sent4: The upgang of balloons soared towards the clouds.
meanings.sent5: The upgang of bubbles floated gracefully upwards.

meanings.definition: To move or go in an upward direction.
meanings.sent1: She decided to upgang the stairs instead of taking the elevator.
meanings.sent2: The hot air balloon started to upgang slowly into the sky.
meanings.sent3: He tried to upgang the hill but slipped and rolled back down.
meanings.sent4: The rocket began to upgang towards outer space.
meanings.sent5: The elevator began to upgang smoothly to the top floor.

meanings.definition: A passage or way leading upward.
meanings.sent1: The narrow upgang in the cave was steep and challenging.
meanings.sent2: The spiral staircase served as the upgang to the tower.
meanings.sent3: The secret upgang hidden behind the bookshelf led to the attic.
meanings.sent4: The upgang through the mountain was treacherous but rewarding.
meanings.sent5: The upgang through the clouds felt like a magical journey.
